message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.SI, cs.IT. 

The paper discusses a framework for training and evaluating Restricted Boltzmann Machines (RBMs), which are commonly used in deep neural architectures. This falls under the category of machine learning, which is covered by several sub-categories in arXiv CS. "cs.LG" (Machine Learning) is the most likely category, as the paper deals with unsupervised learning and training of RBMs. "cs.AI" (Artificial Intelligence) is also likely, as RBMs are a popular tool in AI research. "cs.NE" (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is another possible category, as the paper deals with neural networks. "cs.SI" (Social and Information Networks) is less likely, but still possible, as RBMs can be used in network analysis. Finally, "cs.IT" (Information Theory) is also a possible category, as the paper discusses the use of RBMs as joint priors in denoising problems, which involves information theory concepts.
